* There was no telling when Iron was going to recieve an answer from the 
great ship above but there was one thing that she knew for sure if nothing 
this: She wasn't about to wait around forever.
With other things to concern herself with then the peace treaty of this new 
ship, it wasn't hard to realize that this wasn't the most important topic on 
her list.
So, rather paitently, the black armored humanoid female stood with utmost 
authority infront of the City Gates while Cyndro brought the huge structure 
into Lock-down. Finding that it was pleasent to see the great autoguns 
swivle into place while a shimmering dome of energy slid into place. Now 
THIS was power. Maybe this city wouldn't be such a bad thing after 
all...though it was still hard to forget that it was built without her 
concent and even the thought sent a shiver of bitterness down her spine and 
a stab of insignifigence.  Almost confirming the fact that she was such a 
bad leader that she didn't even have the power to have a say in anything 
that might actually prove to be important.
<...never built to lead.>
Fortunatly, Cyndro's voice broke the cone of silence that threatened to 
develope into self doubt and with a deep breath of surprise Iron responded.*

" Thank you, Cyndro. I'll make sure to inform you of any ferther needs."

* Although, with Prowl's thoughts, it brought her into verbal silence.
< I'm not THAT incompitant, you know. I can handle things out here myself. 
Maybe while I'm dealing with this you can start to learn how to controle 
that SBM of yours, hmm?>*

..................................................

* Tremmor nodded at his unseen commander's orders and skittered away into 
the confins of the city, the sensitive tip of his snout quivering with the 
intensity of new scent and smells.
Though a Maximal by birth...it was pretty confusing to be in a city without 
anyones permission. Like going into a strangers home without asking.
Kinda leaving a rather out-of-place feeling.*

..................................................

* A snout full of fine golden sand couldn't help but cause a mighty sneeze 
which caused the huge cyber wolf to stop in his tracks before continuing on 
down the beach that lined the Alliance Island.
This new land was strange and he hadn't had much time to explore. The beings 
upon it and even the vegitation was rising a fair amount of curiocisy within 
the great beast but it was simpler to explore THIS chunk of land before 
moving onto the clear liquid that seperated it from a larger chunk.*

..................................................

* Zyber settled in the shade of a large pine, letting her misty gaze travel 
over the golden plain that stretched out for miles upon miles on end.
Somewhere out across that expanse lied the Maximal City...as her scanners 
told her.
Would she dare to venture to that place? To dwell among others of her kind 
but in metal surrounding that were unsettling and confining?
Could it be done?
A wild transformer to live with the tame?
It was an interesting thought.*

..................................................

* The drink was stail but she drunk it slowly anyway, finding that it hadn't 
lost it's taste at all. Surprisingly.
Sublime sat at a heavy steel slab which made up one of the 5 tables in the 
city's lounge, sipping at her first drink alone.
It hadn't been all that long since she'd left the sea but already she was 
missing it. Finding it hard to concintrate upon her mission and often was 
caught daydreaming.
She took another sip, letting the warm liquid slide down the length of her 
inner throat before returning her gaze to the vast expance of grassland that 
stretched out beyond the glass that seperated her from it.
How were the other's doing?*

....................................................

* Sighing with visible relief Biomass settled upon the bottom of the ocean, 
looking out through the deep blue mass with a large black eye.
Lately things had been going slow but he'd seen a fair amount.
The Alliance faction was a rather war urged species but only when they had 
to be. Generally annoyable and seriouse...it was interesting though he 
hadn't really interacted with the race.
Nue'e settled down beside the giant squid in her seahorse beats mode, at 
constant alert.
She remembered that giant fish that had almost eaten her commander alive and 
she was sure it was still around...though where?*

.....................................................

* It was like it'de taken FOREVER but they'de reached it finally...panting a 
sore.*

" It's a city, Rion! Look at it!"
